text: A lenticular cloud (Altocumulus lenticularis) is a type of cloud that generally forms at high altitudes. They are shaped like discs and remain roughly in the same position. Because of the way they are shaped, they have been offered as an explanation for some UFO sightings. Lenticular clouds are formed when the wind forces the air up a mountain ridge to where the air is cool enough for water vapor to condense. == References == Category:Clouds
title: Lenticular cloud
